title: How to Bake Chocolate Pinwheel Cookies

steps.headline: Cream the butter, shortening, eggs and vanilla until the mixture looks light and fluffy.
Combine dry ingredients in a mixing bowl.
Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture.
Mix until a soft dough forms.
Divide the dough into 2 equal parts.
Place 1 piece of dough into a mixing bowl.
Add the unsweetened cocoa to the dough.
Mix until well combined.
Wrap each dough in plastic food wrap.
Chill several hours.
Remove the dough from the refrigerator.
Roll out the plain vanilla dough into a 9 x 12-inch rectangle.
Roll out chocolate dough into a 9 x 12-inch rectangle.
Place the chocolate dough over the vanilla dough and try to do this evenly.
'Roll the dough starting on the long side of the cookie dough.
Roll up like a jelly roll.
Chill at least 8 hours or overnight.
Preheat oven to 400 °F (204 °C).
Line baking sheets with parchment paper or nonstick aluminum foil.
Slice cookie dough 1/4-inch thick.
Place cookie slices on parchment paper or nonstick foil lined pan.
Bake 10 minutes or until light golden brown around the edges.
Cool on wire baking racks.

text: Cream the butter, shortening, eggs and vanilla until the mixture looks light and fluffy.  Combine dry ingredients in a mixing bowl.  Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture.  Mix until a soft dough forms.  Divide the dough into 2 equal parts.  Place 1 piece of dough into a mixing bowl.  Add the unsweetened cocoa to the dough.  Mix until well combined.  Wrap each dough in plastic food wrap.  Chill several hours.  Remove the dough from the refrigerator.  Roll out the plain vanilla dough into a 9 x 12-inch rectangle.  Roll out chocolate dough into a 9 x 12-inch rectangle.  Place the chocolate dough over the vanilla dough and try to do this evenly.  'Roll the dough starting on the long side of the cookie dough.  Roll up like a jelly roll.  Chill at least 8 hours or overnight.  Preheat oven to 400 °F (204 °C).  Line baking sheets with parchment paper or nonstick aluminum foil.  Slice cookie dough 1/4-inch thick.  Place cookie slices on parchment paper or nonstick foil lined pan.  Bake 10 minutes or until light golden brown around the edges.  Cool on wire baking racks.
